content: If you are a PhD student, please consider applying for https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/academic-program/phd-fellowship/

@Leonardo de Moura The page about fellowships in Europe says:

Proposed research must be closely related to one of the themes at Microsoft Research Cambridge:
Cloud Infrastructure
Future of Work
Health Intelligence
Confidential Computing

Does this allow Phd students (such as I) working on formal verification to apply?
I would also be very interested in applying for such a position at Microsoft Research Cambridge, but I don't see an easy connection between formalization and any of those themes
Thanks for raising this question. I don't know the answer right now, but I am trying to figure it out. I will post more information soon.
Thanks! Unfortunately I think my institution has an internal application deadline of Monday 30th, which is rather soon
Looking more closely, the information pages list Project Everest as falling within the "Confidential Computing" theme, which at least mentions software verification
